Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
March 10, 2021. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616)552-3662.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.4113 Employee records.
An institution shall maintain employee records for each
employee and shall include documentation of all of the following
information prior to employment or at the time specified in this
rule:
(i) Documentation from the Michigan department of human
services, the equivalent state or Canadian provincial agency, or
equivalent agency in the country where the person usually
resides, that the person has not been determined to be a
perpetrator of child abuse or child neglect. The documentation
shall be completed not more than 30 days prior to the start of
employment and every 12 months thereafter.
Two of nine employee files reviewed lacked documentation of verification the
employee has not been determined to be a perpetrator of child abuse or neglect as
required. In one case the new hire employee check was completed in May 2020 but
was not hired until September exceeding the 30-day time frame prior to employment.
The second case, an employee had a check completed in 2018 and 2020 but not in
2019.
R 400.4114 Tuberculosis screening for employees and volunteers.
The licensee shall document, prior to employment, that each
employee and volunteer who has contact with residents 4 or
more hours per week for more than 2 consecutive weeks is free
from communicable tuberculosis. Freedom from communicable
tuberculosis shall be verified within the 1-year period before
employment and shall be verified every 1 year after the last
verification or prior to the expiration of the current verification.
Three of three employee files reviewed where the employee was employed for over
a year lacked documentation of verification of freedom of tuberculosis every one
year as required. It was noted in all three cases a screening checklist was completed
in accordance with the Communication Issuance 20-062, however a tuberculosis
screening test was never administrated when they became available again as
required.
R 400.4128 Initial staff orientation and ongoing staff training.
(1) The licensee shall provide an orientation program for new
employees.
Job shadowing shall not be the only form of orientation. The
orientation shall include the following:
1

(a) The institution's purpose, policies, and procedures,
including discipline, crisis intervention techniques, and
emergency and safety procedures.
Six of six new hire employee files reviewed lacked documentation that 16 hours of
orientation covering the required topics was provided to the employee prior to the
assumption of their job duties as required.
R 400.4128 Initial staff orientation and ongoing staff training.
(3) The licensee shall document that each staff person whose
function is covered by these rules has participated in a minimum
of 50 clock hours of planned training within the first year of
employment and a minimum of 25 clock hours of training
annually thereafter related to the employee’s job function. At
least 16 of the 50 hours provided in the first year shall be
orientation provided prior to the assumption of duties.
Two of three employee files reviewed where the employee worked for the facility
over one year did not completed 25 hours of annual training as required.
R 400.4153 Shelter care and detention institutions; preliminary service
plans.
Within 7 calendar days of admission, a plan shall be developed
for each resident. The plan shall include all of the following:
(a) The reason for care.
(b) An assessment of the resident’s immediate and specific
needs.
(c) The specific services to be provided by the institution.
(d) Other resources to meet the resident’s needs.
One of three youth files reviewed did not have a preliminary service plan completed
within 7 calendar days of admission as required.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in
compliance will all additional MISEP requirements except for the following:
This facility does not serve plaintiff class youth.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract/Policy violation. Please note
that there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included
in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS Contract/Policy
requirements except for the following:
This facility is not contracted with MDHHS.
2

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
 Provided suggestions on documentation of 16 hours of orientation to include a
form that includes date of hire, date of assuming job responsibilities with list of
required training topics and signatures.
 Provided guidance on file completion as many items were not located in the file
for review and needed to be obtain from elsewhere. Files should be complete
and have all items needed as required.
 The Office manager and consultant reviewed the licensing rules and a link to
the electronic child caring institution rules was provided to the office manager
for review as he is responsible for the contents of the employee files.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was not in need of consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The facility has not been required to submit any corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
I toured the facility during the unannounced onsite inspection. Both the second and
third floor locations were observed to be clean in all areas with no noted safety
concerns. The meal menu was posted in the cafeteria. All medications were locked
in a medication cart behind two locked doors. Youth were not present onsite when I
arrived as they were offsite at a school utilizing the gym. When they returned, they
participated in school in the classroom located on the first floor. During interviews with
youth, they reported feeling safe at Bridgeway and liking everything about the
program thus far. Youth stated staff are supervising them throughout the day and they
are checked on at night at least every 15 minutes. The facility reported a staffing
shortage throughout the last year that has kept their census lower than their 36-youth
capacity. Staff interviews stated that although youth are safe, there are times due to
staffing shortages staff are not always in a safe position being left alone with youth or
not speaking the same language as the youth due to staff from other programs filling
in open shifts. During this inspection, multiple employee file non-compliances were
found, one being directly related to COVID 19. The facility reported the employee
hiring process has changed and the office manager was now in charge of this for the
first time this year.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
3

Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the facility continue their regular license.
